intro: Paullinia hispida, commonly known as the rough soursop, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its rough, thorned stems and large, lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that give way to spherical, spiny fruits. Its fruit is edible, with a sweet and sour flavor, and is often used in local cuisines. The plant also has medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
